document.docTitle: Hymenochaonia kenjinishidai Sharkey & van Achterberg 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Minimalist revision and description of 403 new species in 11 subfamilies of Costa Rican braconid parasitoid wasps, including host records for 219 species

subSubSection.paragraph:
BOLD:ACG8190. Consensus barcode. . Very similar to
H. pallida
(Cresson, 1865) because of the pale colored body and stigma, slender first metasomal tergite and simple tarsal claws. The new species differs by having the first subdiscal cell of forewing approx. 1.5 x longer than wide (approx. 2.5 x in
H. pallida
), vein cu-a of forewing curved (straight) and mesosoma with dark brown pattern (entirely brownish yellow).
Guanacaste, Sector Santa Rosa, Bosque San Emilio, 10.8438 , -85.6138 , 300 meters, 4/vii/2012, Malaise trap. Depository: CNC.

Hymenochaonia kenjinishidai
is named to honor Dr. Kenji Nishida for his intense efforts to read and understand Costa Rican biodiversity.
